figures.figure_caption: Specific free-floating planet production rate as a function of the open cluster central stellar density, for five different galactic open clusters.

Time evolution of the eccentricities of the planetary population of the Pleiades, up to 100 Myr of evolution. The contour plot shows the distribution of eccentricities as a function of time, along with the distribution of eccentricities for the population of bounded planets at the final simulation time. The lower-most orange bar refers to (unperturbed) planets that are still in the initial eccentricity bin (<italic>e</italic><sub>0</sub> ≈ 0.042). This population is the dominant one and it has not been included in the contour plot for the sake of clarity. Finally, the top panel reports the cumulative number of free-floating planets as a function of time, reaching a level ∼800 at the end of the simulation.

Right panel: simulated image of the central region of the Pleiades, after 10 Myr of evolution showing the expected flux at λ = 4.4 μm from stars and free-floating planets. Left panel: a typical field of the NIRCam camera onboard the future <italic>JWST</italic> observatory. The arrow shows the location of a free-floating planet with a surface temperature of ∼500 K.
